title: Labour leaders share South West memories from the campaign trail
content:
Labour's former Plymouth stronghold has proven memorable for the party's new leaders, as they reminisced with members about their time on the campaign trail.

For Jeremy Corbyn, the city's impressive turnout for his husting's visit in August was a demonstration of the public's "thirst" for real political change.

While for deputy Tom Watson, it was where his election speech sent his own daughter to sleep.

The new leadership double act took their trip down memory lane during the…
